content.question: Which of the following will happen if the government raises both taxes and spending by $100 million and the marginal propensity to consume is 0.8?

choices.label: Aggregate demand will decrease, and real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease by a maximum of $500.
Aggregate demand will decrease, and real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease by a maximum of $400.
Aggregate demand will increase, and real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase by a maximum of $100.
Aggregate demand will increase, and real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase by a maximum of $400.
Aggregate demand will increase, and real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase by a maximum of $500.

content.answer: Aggregate demand will increase, and real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase by a maximum of $100.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
